intro: Randia sezitat, commonly known as the narrow-leaved randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, narrow, and often hairy leaves. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pink, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Randia sezitat is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
